topic_metadata.title: How can I rotate based on a value imported from json?

posts.name: mgholam
posts.cooked: I would like to rotate based on an imported json value.
posts.raw: I would like to rotate based on an imported json value.

posts.name: HPCesia
posts.cooked:
Assume you have a rotate.json with the following content:

{
"rotate": 45
}

In the same directory, you have a .typ file with the following content:

#let deg = json("rotate.json").at("rotate") * 1deg
#rotate(deg, [Foo])

You will achieve the effect as shown in the image:
posts.raw:
Assume you have a `rotate.json` with the following content:
```json
{
"rotate": 45
}
```
In the same directory, you have a `.typ` file with the following content:
```typ
#let deg = json("rotate.json").at("rotate") * 1deg
#rotate(deg, [Foo])
```
You will achieve the effect as shown in the image:
![image|402x343, 75%](upload://zPGnKh9W6TDAVZye37fEuX6tgQA.png)

posts.name: mgholam
posts.cooked:
Found a workaround:

rotate(10deg + 1deg * data.angle, [content])

The key is multiplying by a base value otherwise it complains.
posts.raw:
Found a workaround:
```typst
rotate(10deg + 1deg * data.angle, [content])
```
The key is multiplying by a base value otherwise it complains.

posts.name: Alexander Schulz
posts.cooked: Thatâ€™s exactly what @HPCesia proposed as a solution.
posts.raw: That's exactly what @HPCesia proposed as a solution.
